item.title: Bayes Helper
item.description: If you use a test with 95% sensitivity and 95% specificity, and it is positive then you are surly more likely sick than not, right? Well, ... it depends. On the prior probability to be sick (or incidence rate) to be precise. And humans are really bad assessing the meaning of a test result.
